course.subject: ISOM
course.name: Statistical Analysis of Financial Data in R/S-plus
course.description: This course intends to introduce the students to modern data analysis with an emphasis on financial applications. In this course, students will study the data exploration methods, applications of regression and time series, gain experience in analyzing financial data; and become proficient in using statistical software (R or S-Plus) to do estimation, modeling, and forecasting.
course.prerequisites: IEDA 2510 (prior to 2018-19) OR ISOM 2500 OR MATH 2411

reviews.author: Zeta
reviews.title: 集theory同application於一身既好course
reviews.comment_content:
如標題所形容，ISOM4530係一個好精華既elective course，所教既係入門級 (financial) Data anaysis，同時著重statistics既theory，亦都著重實戰既應用 (係R platform之上)。

四大Topics:
1. Univariate data analysis
    - probability density
    - Quantile-Quantile plot
    - Histogram & Kernel Density Estimation
    - Generalized Pareto Distribution for tail fitting
2. Multivariate data analysis
    - Joint distributions
    - Bivariate Normal distribution
3. Regression
    - Simple/ Multiple
    - Linear/ Non-linear
    - Residual diagnostics
4. Time series
    - Linear: Moving Average, Auto-Regressive, ARMA, ARIMA
    - Non-Linear: Mixed normal, ARCH, GARCH

一開始以為個course係教我杜點樣用R，其實prof將重點放左係Statistical analysis度，即是說，就算你玩R好勁，如果唔識stat一樣冇用。所以呢個course有好大部分都係教緊你mathematical既stat，係真係用equation寫出黎既數學，係quantitative; 你會學到每種model背後既運作原理，知到佢地既assumptions, advantage, disadvantage，當你明白晒呢一切之後，prof先會教你實際既model fitting，即係用R。

個人非常欣賞呢個course既setting。因為:
1. 滿足到數學上既渴求
Pre-requisite只要ISOM2500就得，即係所有business人都有得讀。而值得注意既係，個course內容係mathematically oriented，當中有唔少concept的確係深/ 未見過的，所以ISOM4530 offer到既係俾你以最少既數學資歷去體驗一次各大model既beauty，而前提係你會handle到的，只要聽足書。
2. 實用
Data analysis係商業世界既重要程度不在話下，R更加係其中一種最受歡迎既statistical programming language (Qfin個個都要學)，你係CV上話自己識R，已經會同其他人好唔同。而佢教既model，好多都係今時今日出面d人真係用緊既model，regression唔洗講啦，比較有價值既係heavy tails fitting (用GPD)、financial time series fitting (用ARCH/ GARCH)
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof Zheng係一個好熱心教學既老師，講書係有一種激情。
只要你真係想黎學野，佢唔會令你失望。
可能小班教學關係，佢一定會認得你個樣，會知道你跟唔跟得上。
佢好樂意去解答學生問題，同時佢不時會提出一d有趣既問題考我地，一步一步引導我地去發掘平時留意唔到既野。
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading好唔好我真係唔知，因為我都冇問過其他人。拉唔拉curve我都唔知。

Assignment x 5     25%
Midterm                30%
Final                     45%

我總分93.3，A
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload其實算少，平日要做既就係得5份功課。但要注意既係，每份功課都要花你好多時間做的，得兩三條問題，但係花你一日都未必夠做，尤其係要用R做fitting既問題，你可能要對住部電腦幾個鐘狂試唔同input/ coding先會做到你想要既結果。但係呢個係必須要既部分，最好全程自己做，咁你先會學到野，同埋其實幫左你溫書。

至於midterm同final呢，只要你平時上足堂、聽足書、抄足notes、有唔明即刻問，咁考之前已經會輕鬆好多，因為要明白既野你都明左，淨低只係睇多一次ppt同溫多次功課就可以。而且兩次考試都俾帶cheat sheet，所以根本唔洗特登背乜野。

reviews.author: wclh
reviews.title: this is the most honest, non-qfin student review
reviews.comment_content:
If you think that you have a chance to get a good grade in this course after reading all the comments, they are just qfin ppl who tried to lure you in so u can eff up for the next qfin batch taking this course.
I am an om student so I guess my review is rather honest. Please do ponder carefully whether you have enough ability to study this course.
If you think the compulsory math course and ISOM2500 is easy peasy for you, then yes, you might actually get a good grade in here. Otherwise, please look for other courses as om elective coz it's a bloodbath here.
Indeed, as other's have mentioned, calculation is not quite needed, but it doesn't make any difference as it requires you to understand all the logic behind. It is impossible for you to get through this course, even if you luckily manage to copy homework answer from coursehero you're gonna be finished like a cake in midterm and final project
The beginning part is handlable if you have some M1 dse background knowledge, like normal distribution n stuff. The second part, time series, which is the main part for you to do your project, it's quite hard to understand (even if I consider myself as having an above-average math ability).
reviews.comment_teaching:
English is unbelievably hard to understand
Even I am a local student (which somehow should help me understand Chinese accent better?) and zoom subtitles cannot help with the issue
It is the major reason causing me unable to understand the course contents comprehensively
But to be fair he has passion for teaching
TA is nice and quite helpful in helping us to pick up the bits
reviews.comment_grading:
You can take reference to the grading breakdown from other comments
Luckily I have good teammates in the project so my marks are
HW1: 97/100
HW2-6: 100/100
HW7: 90/100
Project: 87/100 (I don't really remember clearly, can't find the score either as the prof probably shut down the canvas page, but it's above mean)
Midterm: 91/100
final grade: A- (I got really lucky to have good teammates)
reviews.comment_workload:
homework usually takes more than hours to finish but it does help you to clarify some concepts
at the same time you have to do quite a lot of revision before you have the background knowledge to finish the homework (unless you are really good at math i.e. qfin student)
midterm is not really that hard (if you work your ass off to study)
the final project was suffering, there are two projects, each requires a 10-page report, you have to predict stock price for one project and another one is anything (you can set the topic yourself). Most importantly, the project is released a week prior to the final period and prof required us to submit it DURING the finals and you also have to finish HW7 at that time too

reviews.author: Jackie0925
reviews.title: Grading is lenient
reviews.comment_content:
FIVE DEMANDS NOT ONE LESS!!!

The course provides a glimpse of many advanced models with application in R. The detailed class rundown is as follows:

Syllabus:
1. Univariate Exploratory Data Analysis
- First examples of nancial data
- Parametric estimation for the standard distribution families
- Nonparametric density estimation
- Q-Q plots, VaR, extreme events and heavy tail distributions
- First Monte Carlo simulations

2. Multivariate Exploratory Data Analysis
- Multivariate distributions; multivariate Gaussian (normal) distribution
- Dependence; correlation coecient

3. Parametric Regression
- Simple linear regression
- Diagnostics, measures of influence and robust alternatives
- Linear statistical models
- ANOVA
- Polynomial regression
- Nonlinear regression techniques
- Natural splines

4. Time Series Models
- Stochastic processes: seasonal e ffects, stationarity, mean, autocovariance and autocorrelation functions
- Linear time series: White Noise (WN), AutoRegressive (AR) processes, Moving Average (MA) processes, ARMA
- Forecasting procedures for time series
- Nonlinear time series: ARCH, GARCH
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor has a typical mainland China accent. Sometimes it's hard to catch up what he is talking, especially when it comes to some terminologies. I think he explains too fast in some advanced concepts. The lectures conducted in online form have many technical problems and he only cares about mainland students. In general, he is passionate about teaching.
reviews.comment_grading:
Due to the shameless government, the final exam has changed to a final project.

7 assignments (20%) --> mean around 90% overall
mid-term exam (25%) --> mean 85, sd 9
final project (55%) --> mean 79.5, sd 10

The class is competitive because there are QFIN students enrol in the course.

I got around mean in assignments, +0.7sd in mid-term and -0.6 sd in the final project. I got a B as last, which is very lenient. Professor gives better grades than he did in ISOM 2500, possibly because of the difficulty of this course.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is very high. Lots of time and effort to understand the class content. Also, there are assignments after assignments. Some of the assignments are so difficult that have to spend more than 4 hours to complete. The mid-term exam is manageable.

reviews.author: holam
reviews.title: ISOM 4530
reviews.comment_content:
See syllabus, overall, the content is quite good and useful

Prof: this is a diffcult course, you can drop it as this is not a compulsory course
TA: this is a difficult course, you should think whether to drop it

My comment: it is a difficult course

Second thing: too many QFINers
In this semester, there are at least 9-10 year4/5 QFIN in this course, thus I believe will push the curve very high.

It would be good if you have studied ECON 3334/ MATH 2421 before this course.(maybe good for a specific major in business school?!)
I don't think it is worth to study this course if you just want to get the font size 8 written on your graduation certificate (OM option)without good statistical background
reviews.comment_teaching:
It is okay for me, at least I attend all class without fall asleep (which is already quite difficult for me)
Attending lesson may be useful for the midterm
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignments (20%)
7 Assignments in total
Mean: 653.6/700
Me: 683/700
I guess the highest maybe 700/700 since every hw has ppl got full mark

The TA grade the HW quite lenient, even if you something wrong he simply deducts only 4-5 marks for a huge mistake

Midterm (25%)
Mean: 82.6
Highest: 100
Lowest: 56
SD: 13
Me: 93

The midterm only covers to bivariate distribution, and it is a quite early midterm in the week 5/6. 10MC+14T/F + 8 Short questions

Note that some of the questions are asking how to conduct an analysis with regard to sth. So if you attend a real semester, your cheat sheet should copy the steps of conducting analysis that appear in the lecture notes


Final Project (55%)
2 projects required (each 10 page, max 4 ppl per group)
1. Common Project (42.5%)
Given more than 100000 rows 5-min asset data(price/volume/order imbalance, buyFreq, sellFreq, tradeFreq, bidFreq, askFreq etc.), to predict the next 5-min price change using regression. Quite difficult for me
The most common mistake is USING FUTURE INFORMATION for regression.

2.  Time series project (42.5%)
Find own data to do report, but the TA and prof already says that they do not expect any fancy things. It is ok to replicate sth in lecture notes. The major point is how to create the problem statetment

For the whole project, 90% of my  content are copied from the lecture notes, so maybe using additional information is risky?!

Also note that 15% of the final project score is from peer evaluation, so maybe treat your groupmates well?!

Final project mark: low: 74.5 high: 91.5 me: 91.34
mean: 85.6
sd: 3.87
median: 85.97
The TA said our group project ranked 2nd in common project and 1st in time series project. I really cannot imagine how can we beat those year 4/5 QFINers!!

2-3 hours for each one

reviews.author: KarenOu
reviews.comment_content: The content is the same as other students suggested. It won't be difficult for students who take probability courses before (eg. MATH2411 / 2421). But it gets more difficult when professors began to cover time series part.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor Zheng welcomes all kinds of questions and could answer them in a simple and comprehensive way. Rather than explaining the mathematics behind, he will adopt an economic approach to help you understand the concepts.

You could grasp the coding part either in in-class demonstration or in tutorials.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is quite good. Most students get full marks for assignments. But the grading of assignment could be a bit subjective, depending on how the TA thinks of your answers and explanation.

The short questions in midterm are a bit tricky, and marks are deducted for explanation that are slightly different from the standard answers.

This semester we didn't have final exam, but a group project instead. We were required to conduct quantitative analysis on two different data sets and try to answer two interesting questions with the insights generated from your analysis and model.

Grading:
Midterm: 91/100
6 Assignments: 96% on average
Final project 86/100
Final grade: A
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is quite small if you are familiar with coding in R. Most codes for assignment could be found in lecture codes. The assignment is once every two weeks.

reviews.author: Peter Lau
reviews.title: The best course for learning time series analysis
reviews.comment_content:
Note: I am NOT a QFIN student.

The content is very comprehensive as an introductory time series analysis course (but the content is quite hard if you are not math savvy). You will be able to learn all the basic time series models and modern financial data analysis techniques (mainly using R). Both statistical theories and practical implementation methods are discussed in this course.

Syllabus:
1. Univariate Exploratory Data Analysis
- First examples of financial data
- Parametric estimation for the standard distribution families
- Nonparametric density estimation
- Q-Q plots, VaR, extreme events and heavy tail distributions
- First Monte Carlo simulations

2. Multivariate Exploratory Data Analysis
- Multivariate distributions; multivariate Gaussian (normal) distribution
- Dependence; correlation coecient

3. Parametric Regression
- Simple linear regression
- Diagnostics, measures of influence and robust alternatives
- Linear statistical models
- ANOVA
- Polynomial regression
- Nonlinear regression techniques
- Natural splines

4. Time Series Models
- Stochastic processes: seasonal effects, stationarity, mean, autocovariance and autocorrelation functions
- Linear time series: White Noise (WN), AutoRegressive (AR) processes, Moving Average (MA) processes, ARMA
- Forecasting procedures for time series
- Nonlinear time series: ARCH, GARCH
reviews.comment_teaching:
平心而論，個Professor係真係教得好有heart，同埋解釋得都算清楚

The instructor is really enthusiastic about teaching. He explains the concepts clearly with mathematical formulas and many real-world examples in the notes. Also, he is very willing to answer students' questions.

One interesting thing is that he may ask questions in the lecture and will use a R program to randomly draw a student (the photo, name and midterm scores will be shown on the screen... good luck haha).
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is based on three things:
- 7 Assignments: 20% in total
- Midterm: 30% (Mean: 84/100, SD: 11, Median: 85, My Scores: 99/100)
- Final: 50% (Mean: 81/100, SD: 14, Median: 83, My Scores: 99.5/100)

My Overall Scores: 99.28%
Final Grade: A+

You can bring a cheat sheet to the exams. Remember to write down all the steps of the empirical methods for running different kinds of tests, simulations and models as they may be tested in the exams (e.g. you may be asked how to practically do a Monte Carlo simulation or calculate the VaR/Expected Shortfall).
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is acceptable as an advanced course. There are seven assignments in total. You will need to use R to analyse the given data sets or doing some simple mathematical derivations on the given equations. They are not easy and may require a lot of time to finish them. However, it is rewarding to do the assignments because you will be able to consolidate the concepts learnt in lectures and get a taste of the how to practically run the models in R.

reviews.author: ztyxfd2912
reviews.title: Nice course to learn something
reviews.comment_content: just like the other guys said
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor's English is hard to understand. But his PPT is clear and contains enough explanations for you to comprehend even if you didn't listen in class.
reviews.comment_grading:
Got above mean in both mt and final, around lower quartile in most hws and two 100 for hw. Ended up B+. As most students get high scores in this course, I guess paying more attention to hws could do lots of help.
The exam questions are trivial and asks for basic things, like the properties of LS and LAD. The homeworks are harder, but getting full marks is common and it was my own fault to do them poorly.
reviews.comment_workload: Average for a 4 credit course. I'm taking MATH2121 the same semester and it has 10 easy questions and 10 very hard questions every week, so I'm grateful for ISOM4530 actually.

reviews.author: Al3xia
reviews.comment_content:
The content is very interesting and covers a lot of topics in statistic.
The midterm exam covered the first 6 lectures which included distribution (types of distribution), QQ plots, VaR calculation and Multivariate distribution. The topics before the midterm are quite easy and straightforward.
After the midterm, the content covered will be about time series and it is much more challenging. I would suggest to attend all the lectures and take notes especially on this part of the course as it may be difficult to catch up on the content.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The english is very difficult to understand unfortunately.
The professor is very passionate about the course and it is clear, however he has a very heavy accent and at the beginning is impossible to understand.
Take a lot of notes!!! The lecturer will add more content than it is present in the slides and such notes are very useful.
reviews.comment_grading:
• 10% Attendance (up to 3 absences with legitimate reasons permitted)
• 20% Assignments - 6 assignments
• 25% Midterm Examination
• 45% Final Examination
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is fair. I expected it to be more intensive.
Every two weeks an assignment will be realised: it will test your coding abilities with some theoretical explanation. They will take a couple of hours to be completed.
The exams may scare you a first but the lecturer allows you to bring 1 page front and back A4 cheatsheet where you can write down some information and don't have to memorise everything.
Furthermore, the exams are quite straightforward if you understand the content and have studied.

reviews.author: iwantlenggrade
reviews.title: Honest review from om student
reviews.comment_content:
Rich and useful content about statistic and time series.
Midterm content is about statistic, different kinds of distribution, Q-Q plots, VaR calculation, Multivariate distributions, etc. If you think ISOM 2500 is easy, you may find it easy as well.
Time series will be covered in the second half of the course. It is quite hard to understand. You may need to find extra time to study or find online material to strengthen your understanding, especially there will be many qfin students studying this course as well.
reviews.comment_teaching:
English is quite hard to understand at the beginning, and it is hard to keep focus for 3 hours after lunch.
If you want to get good grade in this course, you have to pay full attention in each class and don't skip any class, unless you learnt the content before. Otherwise, it is nearly impossible to catch up.
One more reminder, you have to jot down lots of notes in class, so better prepare an ipad or print out the slides before going to class, you will definitely find the notes helpful.
reviews.comment_grading:
Fair grading, the mean is quite high.

• 10% Attendance (up to 3 absences with legitimate reasons permitted)
• 20% Assignments
• 25% Midterm Examination
• 45% Final Examination

Full Attendance
Full Marks on 6 assignments
Midterm above mean, Median: 88/100
Final slightly above mean, Median: 90/100
A range
reviews.comment_workload:
I would say the workload is not the lightest but may not be as intensive as you think.
6-7 assignment using R code and some more extra explanation for your analysis.
Each assignment takes a few hours to complete.
For midterm and final, it allows you to bring cheat sheet, so you don't have to memorize a lot of things, as long as you fully understand the content.
